items.title: Four new arrests made following Louvre jewellery heist
items.description: Two men and two women from Paris are the latest to be questioned as part of the ongoing investigation.

items.title: Jury trials could be scrapped in England and Wales except for most serious cases
items.description: Only cases of alleged murder, rape or manslaughter will be decided by a jury under new proposals to cut court backlogs.

items.title: Red Cross receives coffin said to contain Gaza hostage's body
items.description: The remains will be transferred to Israeli forces, who will take them to Israel's forensic medicine institute for identification.

items.title: Same-sex marriage must be respected throughout EU, top court tells Poland
items.description: The ruling covers the case of a Polish couple who married in Berlin but Polish authorities refused to recognise their marriage.

items.title: Graham Linehan cleared of harassing trans activist but guilty of damaging phone
items.description: Comedy writer Graham Linehan "deliberately whacked" a teenage trans woman's phone out of her hand, a court heard.
